Articles.Content:
Oddcasionally, very rarely, I have a stange bug manifesting.

A ship will "lose" its orbital speed, and sit there frozen in space.

Tracking station shows it as suborbital, about to plummet vertically to whatever body it is(was) orbiting. But it doesn't move at all, until I enter it.

When I enter the ship, if I manage to get it moving within 1/2 second or so, it survives but with zero effective velocity. If I take too long to thrust, it freaks out the interface and attains speed "NaN" altitude shows as rolling numbers. Then crash to desktop.

I have only seen this happen when I have multiple ships in the same SOI. (as in 5++)

What causes this bug, and more importantly how can I prevent it, or recover a ship that I know is in such a state?

Edited May 27, 2014 by MarvinKitFox

I think this may be the 'frozen orbit' bug documented in Claw's excellent http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/77327-20May-0-23-5-Issues-Fix-Crashes-Decoupler-EVA-Career-Save-Won-t-Start-more. Have a read but, I'm afraid, don't expect good news :-(
